name: Scarlett Johansson
religion: Scarlett's mother is Jewish and her father Danish (which implies at least some sort of Christian heritage). She seems to identify more with her Jewish roots.
politicalViews: Johannson is a registered Independent but seems to have endorsed every Democrat that comes her way.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Scarlett Johansson is a New York City Jewish girl, born and raised. And the fact that she's a giant movie star makes her basically a walking cliche.
Her father is Danish–not Jewish, but her mother is a Jew and Scarlett seems to identify more with her Jewish side, even though when asked if she celebrates Christmas or Hanakkuh, she said:

content.sourceTitle: Match Point Interview with Scarlett Johansson

content.text: It appears that the other Jewish holidays get a bit more attention, however. She said about her family:

content.sourceTitle: Scarlett Johansson speaks about her Jewish ancestry
content.text: We have Rosh Hashanah. We have Hanakkuh and Passover.
Plus, she's pals with Woody Allen.

content.sourceTitle: Scarlett Johansson & Ryan Reynolds Wedding Details
content.text: There's a sense that religion either isn't a big deal to Johansson or she's very private about it, which tends to be her attitude towards much of her life. Her wedding to actor Ryan Reynolds was, as Johansson puts it, planned in dark alleys and took place in the remote wilderness of Canada, leaving us to speculate if it was Jewish, Christian, a combination, or just a secular ceremony.

Johansson is a registered Independent, probably because she thinks its cool to be open-minded, but she's not voting for any Republicans. She endorsed John Kerry in 2004 and when he lost to George W. Bush, she said:
[I was] disappointed. I think it was a disappointment for a large percentage of the population.
She took the Democrats' side again in 2008, endorsing Barack Obama and even went on a small speaking tour on his behalf. She said that Obama is an opportunity to:
…turn a page on the polarizing politics of the past… My heart belongs to Barack.
In 2012, Johansson stepped up for Obama once again and even hosted a fashion-themed fundraiser for the president's re-election campaign.

content.sourceTitle: Scarlett Johansson to Host Another Fundraiser for Scott Stringe
content.text: For the 2013 New York City mayor race, Johansson endorsed Democrat Scott Stringer over incumbent Republican Michael Bloomberg, hosting numerous fundraisers for Stringer's campaign.
All in all, she doesn't seem that "independent."
